description.narrative: The Accelerator Lab will promote out-of-the-box thinking and experimentation to support Small Island Developing States (SIDS), with a focus on Caribbean countries, in the sustainable development of its ocean-based economic sectors.

activity-description.narrative: Support for the sustainable development of the regional ocean-based economic sector

description.narrative: 1. Number of Blue Economy interventions supported through the Accelerator Lab 2. Number of innovative blue economy solutions scaled # of female blue economy innovators receiving TA/ partnership generation 3. # of blue economy stakeholders / organizations with capacity to scale / innovate blue economy solutions, #of blue economy stakeholders educated on scaling, # of stakeholders educated on innovation in experimentation, # of blue economy stakeholders with increased knowledge on innovation in experimentation, # of female blue economy stakeholders receiving technical assistance 4. # / % of trainees who have mastered knowledge on the blue economy concept and sectors , # persons with increased knowledge of the blue economy and innovation over time, , # women with increased knowledge of the blue economy over time # of female trainees, # of female trainees from blue economy sector 5. # listeners, # downloads, # hits, # of impressions, #of female voices/guests 6. # of operational Blue Champions, #of of female/youth Blue Champions, # of downloads of Blue Economy "New Normal" toolkit 7. # of regional Blue Economy innovators using platform/hub, # of female Blue Economy innovators using platform/hub

comment.narrative:
Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 91 developing countries.
Output Indicators 1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. Target: 2 new sources of data per year
1.2 Diversity of different data sources used Target: 3 different types of data sources per year
1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented Target: 20 new potential solutions per lab per year
1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. Target: 2 innovation methods per action plan
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets.
2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) Target: 3
2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners Target: At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart
2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite Target: At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods.
2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies Target: At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning 3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs Target: The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network 48 interaction per year
3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. Target: 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related.
3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. Target: The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation
3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem. Target: Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media.
Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

1: 4
Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 91 developing countries.
Output Indicators 1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. Target: 2 new sources of data per year
1.2 Diversity of different data sources used Target: 3 different types of data sources per year
1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented Target: 20 new potential solutions per lab per year
1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. Target: 2 innovation methods per action plan
Output 2 2.1: 6 2.2: At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3: At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4: At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3 3.1: The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network 48 interaction per year
3.2:25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related.
3.3: The Accelerator Lab Networks' work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts.
The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account.
3.4: Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media.
Identify and engage with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

Output 3 3.1: 48 3.2: 50% 3.3: The Accelerator Lab Network’s work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts.
